posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
I would say Monk Fighter Rogue is a bad idea if you can't use magic items, you're better off with some Cleric in there to compensate the lack of magical items with buffs. Monk 12 Cleric 15 Rogue 3 will do very well and with Haste he'll be able to flee any dangerous situation that he can't handle by kicking butt! Plus, you can get the Plant domain to have access to Barkskin, as you'll have haste as a Kensai.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Oh, there's a 30-level maximum. That changes things. Still, 12 levels of Monk would not give you the maximum damage with unarmed, and non-magical kamas would be underwhelming.

How about Monk 20 / Fighter 5 / Shadowdancer 5? That would get you Epic Weapon Spec, Epic Dodge, Uncanny Dodge, and Hide in Plain Sight. Are any of those feats forbidden or nerfed?

If Epic Dodge is out of the question, how about Monk 20 / Fighter 10? That would get you Epic Weapon Spec and you can use epic Fighter feats for Armor Skin and Epic Prowess, leaving general feats free for Great DEX.

Both of these would have 4 Fighter pre-epic to give you that last attack per round.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:Oh, there's a 30-level maximum. That changes things. Still, 12 levels of Monk would not give you the maximum damage with unarmed, and non-magical kamas would be underwhelming.

How about Monk 20 / Fighter 5 / Shadowdancer 5? That would get you Epic Weapon Spec, Epic Dodge, Uncanny Dodge, and Hide in Plain Sight. Are any of those feats forbidden or nerfed?

If Epic Dodge is out of the question, how about Monk 20 / Fighter 10? That would get you Epic Weapon Spec and you can use epic Fighter feats for Armor Skin and Epic Prowess, leaving general feats free for Great DEX.

Both of these would have 4 Fighter pre-epic to give you that last attack per round.

These are all bad suggestions IMO, as the OP said he can't use magical items. All melee-oriented classes are item-dependant, or at least more so than casters / self-buffers Taking 4 FTR pre-epic means his BAB will be 16, which is not good if you consider he will have to rely only on his stats to attack. With 12 Monk levels, he will do 1d12 damage, not the max, true, but still double what a Kama can do, and he will have Divine Power and Divine Favor at his disposal for +10 AB. Now EWS will give him a total of +6 damage with the chosen type of attack, while Divine Favor alone will give him +5 damage, plus whatever he can gain from Divine Power as a STR bonus and if you want, count in Battletide (+2 Magical damage and +2 AB, plus reducing enemy AB and damage by 2) and prayer (+1 AB and damage and if cast near the enemy will further reduce their AB and damage by 1). Not to mention Wisdom-based AC and Cleric WIsdom and DEX buffs. IMO Cleric is the best way to go for someone who won't use any magical items.

Take it EZ!
